io.craigmiller160.stockmarket.model

Class GUIStateModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.craigmiller160.mvp.core.AbstractPropertyModel
      • io.craigmiller160.stockmarket.model.GUIStateModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    @ThreadSafe
public class GUIStateModel
extends io.craigmiller160.mvp.core.AbstractPropertyModel
    A JavaBean bound property model that defines the current state of the GUI of the StockMarket program.

    THREAD SAFETY: This class is completely thread safe. The only mutable field is an int, which cannot be affected by a reference leak.

    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    craig
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Constructor and Description
      GUIStateModel()
      Creates a new instance of this bound property model.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GUIStateModel

        public GUIStateModel()
        Creates a new instance of this bound property model. Sets the portfolio state to CLOSED by default.

    • Method Detail

      • setPortfolioState

        public void setPortfolioState(PortfolioState portfolioState)
        Sets the current state of the portfolio, which determines which components should be enabled/disabled, shown/hidden, etc. This is a bound property, and a PropertyChangeEvent is fired when it is changed.
        Parameters:
        portfolioState - the state of the portfolio.

      • getPortfolioState

        public PortfolioState getPortfolioState()
        Returns the program state affecting which components are enabled/disabled.
        Returns:
        the state of which components are enabled/disabled.

      • setDialogDisplayed

        public void setDialogDisplayed(Dialog dialog,
                               java.lang.Object... dialogConfig)
        Set which dialog should be currently displayed. Note that this value does not need to be changed when it is no longer being displayed. Configuration information for the dialog is passed along as part of the parameter array. This is a bound property, and a PropertyChangeEvent is fired when it is changed.
        Parameters:
        dialog - the constant name for the dialog to display.
        dialogConfig - optional configuration information for displaying the dialog.

      • getDialogDisplayed

        public java.lang.Object[] getDialogDisplayed()
        Get the configuration information for the dialog that was most recently displayed. Because this value does not necessarily get cleared when the dialog is closed, the value returned can only be guaranteed to be the last one displayed.
        Returns:
        the configuration information for the dialog that was most recently displayed.
